intro: Latrobea pinnaculum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is aromatic, and it produces seeds in small, dry fruits. Latrobea pinnaculum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
